newsitem.title: ITALY: Liberian soccer star Weah in Africa peace call.
newsitem.headline: Liberian soccer star Weah in Africa peace call.

text.p: Liberian soccer star George Weah, whose country has been torn apart by war, said on Wednesday that he hoped a U.N.-organised World Food Summit would produce concrete results after the talking was over.
"I believe it to be a well-timed initiative," the 1995 world player of the year told Italian radio.
"I hope that this renewed interest leads to concrete results and does not end with this event."

Weah, who has dipped into his own pockets to help the cash-strapped Liberian soccer team play international matches, said he wanted to help those institutions working to unite peoples and bring peace to warring nations.
The Milan striker said Africa was going through a very major crisis and called on all nations of the world to unite in helping not just Africa but all with problems.
Weah has frequently spoken out for peace in Africa in the past, sometimes at considerable personal cost.
His luxury $100,000 seaside mansion in Monrovia was burned down by guerrillas in May after he publicly supported calls for Liberia to become a United Nations trusteeship.
